goal.tools.debugger

Class DebugEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.logging.LogRecord
      • goal.tools.logging.GOALLogRecord
        • goal.tools.debugger.DebugEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DebugEvent
extends GOALLogRecord
    Stores information about a (debug) event.
    Author:
    W.Pasman June 2008
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DebugEvent

        public DebugEvent(SteppingDebugger.RunMode mode,
          java.lang.String source,
          java.lang.String message,
          Channel channel)
        Creates a debug event for some channel, with no associated object.
        Parameters:
        mode - The run mode of the debugger that generated the event. (RUNNING, STEPPING, PAUSED or null; should not be KILLED)
        source - The source (typically a debugger) that created the event
        message - Some description of the event. Usually a breakpoint message.
        channel - The channel on which the event is published.

      • DebugEvent

        public DebugEvent(SteppingDebugger.RunMode mode,
          java.lang.String source,
          java.lang.String message,
          Channel channel,
          java.lang.Object association)
        Creates a debug event for some channel, with some associated object.
        Parameters:
        mode - The run mode of the debugger that generated the event. (RUNNING, STEPPING, PAUSED or null; should not be KILLED)
        source - The source (typically a debugger) that created the event
        message - Some description of the event. Usually a breakpoint message.
        channel - The channel on which the event is published.
        association - The object to associate with this DebugEvent. May be null if the event is not associated with any object.

    • Method Detail

      • getRunMode

        public SteppingDebugger.RunMode getRunMode()
        Returns the run mode reported by the event.
        Returns:
        RUNNING, STEPPING, PAUSED or null (cannot be KILLED as a KILLED agent does not generate events).

        public java.lang.String getSource()
        DOC
        Returns:

      • getChannel

        public Channel getChannel()
        Returns:
        The channel on which this event was published

      • getAssociatedObject

        public java.lang.Object getAssociatedObject()
        Returns:
        The object associated with this DebugEvent. May be null.

        public java.util.logging.Formatter getFormatter()
        Specified by:

        Returns:
        A Formatter to properly format this record.
